content.title: Nari Niketans
content.department: Department of Social Welfare, Government of Jammu & Kashmir
content.details: The Nari Niketans provide shelter and support to deserted, destitute ladies, and widows who have no means of livelihood.
benefits: Care and protection in the institutions
Free education for school-going destitute girls
eligibility: Deserted / Destitute Ladies / Widows having no means of livelihood
exclusions: Women with permanent employment are not eligible
Citizens from neighboring states cannot apply
content.application_process: The beneficiary shall approach the concerned DSWO for submission of the application.
documents_required: Death Certificate of the Husband (if applicable)
Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of Jammu & Kashmir

faqs.question: Where can I find the contact details of the officers of the Nari Niketan?
faqs.answer: The district-wise contact details can be found at - https://jksocialwelfare.nic.in/welfareIns/NariNiketans.pdf

faqs.question: In which years were the 'Nari Niketans' established?
faqs.answer: The 'Nari Niketans' were established in the UT of Jammu & Kashmir in the year 1976.

faqs.question: How many Nari Niketans are there in Jammu & Kashmir?
faqs.answer: There are seven Nari Niketans in Jammu & Kashmir.

faqs.question: What is the total capacity of all the Nari Niketans in Jammu & Kashmir?
faqs.answer: The total capacity of all the Nari Niketans in Jammu & Kashmir is 280.

faqs.question: Which is the only district in Jammu & Kashmir to have two Nari Niketans?
faqs.answer: Poonch is the only district in Jammu & Kashmir to have two Nari Niketans.

faqs.question: For how long can an inmate remain in the institution?
faqs.answer: The inmate shall remain in the institution till they are rehabilitated/get married/covered under any schemes for employment and self-employment.

faqs.question: Are the children accompanying the mothers also entitled to admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, the children accompanying the mothers will be entitled to admission subject to the condition that male children after they attain the age of 8 years shall be transferred to Bal Ashrams.

faqs.question: What basic facilities are provided to the inmates?
faqs.answer: The inmates are provided care and protection, food, shelter, bedding & clothing.

faqs.question: Can old-age women also apply to this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are no criteria with respect to the age of the applicant.

faqs.question: Is the residential certificate / domicile certificate of Jammu & Kashmir a mandatory document for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a mandatory document.

faqs.question: Can I reapply to this scheme if I am already availing the benefits?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot reapply if you already have availed of its benefits.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No, the application process is entirely free of cost.

faqs.question: Where can I find the link to the scheme guidelines?
faqs.answer: The Scheme Guidelines can be found at this link - https://jkdswdj.jk.gov.in/welfareSchemes/NARI%20NIKETANS.pdf

faqs.question: What is the link to the website of the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Jammu & Kashmir?
Is it mandatory to self-attest all the required documents?
faqs.answer: Yes, all required documents must be self-attested.
